triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: The paper uses mixed integer programming methodology in its data-driven selection process for compiling the MIPLIB benchmark.

triples.name: Benchmark (computing)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes MIPLIB 2017, a new benchmark collection of 1065 instances with a specialized 240-instance subset for solver performance evaluation.

triples.name: Combinatorial optimization
triples.relevance: The paper addresses combinatorial optimization problems through the selection and compilation of mixed integer programming instances.

triples.name: Data-driven model
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel data-driven selection process using mixed integer optimization to compile the benchmark library.

triples.name: Mathematical optimization
triples.relevance: The paper relies on mathematical optimization techniques to encode requirements on diversity and balancedness in the selection process.
